title: No sign out
text: I have had my Gmail account for many years & have always been pleased with it up to now.  I recently upgraded to a new cell phone & had difficulty getting Gmail to unlock my account to give me access with the 2 step verification turned on.  I eventually got in through recovery and turned off the 2 step verification process.  I discovered that your gmail app had changed & no longer had the ‚Äúsign out‚Äù option under the Gmail user profile.  I couldn‚Äôt close & log out the my Gmail account app from my new cell phone.  I looked under the Help tips for the log out options.  It stated the only way to close & log out of your Gmail account is to remove the app from your account device manager or leave it open.   Also, it stated depending on which device you're logged into will depend on if you have the sign out option access or not.  I have it on my laptop when I log into Gmail.  My old cellphone also had the sign out option for Gmail so I could log out of my account, but it‚Äôs not an option on my new cellphone.  It leaves my Gmail account unlocked & accessible to potential users or hackers through the back door.  This is poor security programming in the system‚Äôs application.  It should be fixed immediately.

title: Going downhill like the rest of Google
text: This used to be an amazing app. Google used to be amazing. Now the push to use smart replies and suggestions is unbearable, and the latest ugly, space hoggung, smart contact suggestion bubbles can't even be turned off. It's like theyre trying to push their remaining folks right out the door. Myself and my peers are moving to Proton and icloud email domains because this is getting ridiculous. Every time I open the Gmail app there's some new feature that isn't useful to me that I need to turn off. And Im an engineer - not some fuddy duddy non-techy. Google's features just are going in the wrong direction.

title: duplicate emails, not enough control
text:
Very very frustrating app.
I have multiple email accounts going into the app. I get all of my emails (and email notifications) twice, for absolutely no discernible reason.
I have turned off all my labels using the desktop app; changes do not propagate. Emails are still marked as ‚Äúimportant‚Äù which I do not want.
Nowhere near enough control over my UX, especially for someone who is using multiple accounts and profiles.
When I tap into an email from a notification, the app does not register it as ‚Äúread;‚Äù I have to go back to inbox and click on it again.

But the duplicate situation is the level worst. Mind-blowingly stupid behavior, and a web search makes it clear that this is a very common and longstanding issue.
